item.title: Design

item.title: Deception Detection
item.description: Over the last several years, I have been looking to understand how people detect deception. This work has encompased a variety of behavioral and neural methods to examine unconscious detection of deception.

item.title: Education
item.description: The University of Texas at Dallas, Richardson, TX Ph.D., Cognition and Neuroscience, Aug. 2016 - present M.S., Applied Cognition and Neuroscience, Aug. 2014- May 2016 Baylor University, Waco, TX

item.title: Other Interests
item.description: When I’m not in school, you can find me at a local Dallas yoga studio taking class (or teaching it!), flying in the air on silks or lyra, or capturing moments through photography.

item.title: Connect With Me
item.description: You can connect with me on social media

item.title: Cyber Deception
item.description: Along with our collaborators in UT Dallas’ Computer Science department, we have been exploring ways to better understand deception online and in the world of cyber security. In addition, we are looking at ways to utilize human-machine teaming to make better decisions about deception detection.
